item.title: Feeling Sidelined By Mainstream Social Media, Far-Right Users Jump To Gab
item.description: May 21, 2017 - Criticized for being affiliated with the alt-right, the social site Gab now reports 170,000 users. It has found a niche among some conservatives and others who feel stifled by Facebook and Twitter.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 21, 2017 - Criticized for being affiliated with the alt-right, the social site Gab now reports 170,000 users. It has found a niche among some conservatives and others who feel stifled by Facebook and Twitter. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/21/529005840/feeling-sidelined-by-mainstream-social-media-far-right-users-jump-to-gab

item.title: Don't Feed Parrots Chocolate, Despite What Happens In Minecraft
item.description: May 20, 2017 - In the game Minecraft, a chocolate chip cookie will tame a parrot, but they're poisonous to the birds in real life. Minecraft has promised to update the game.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - In the game Minecraft, a chocolate chip cookie will tame a parrot, but they're poisonous to the birds in real life. Minecraft has promised to update the game. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/20/529257386/dont-feed-parrots-chocolate-despite-what-happens-in-minecraft

item.title: Small Indiana Nonprofit Falls Victim To Ransom Cyberattack
item.description:
May 20, 2017 - A small Indiana nonprofit was devastated by a malware attack earlier this year. It's still recovering after hackers stole data.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/05/20/529257365/small-indiana-nonprofit-falls-victim-to-ransom-cyberattack
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - A small Indiana nonprofit was devastated by a malware attack earlier this year. It's still recovering after hackers stole data. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/20/529257365/small-indiana-nonprofit-falls-victim-to-ransom-cyberattack

item.title: In Google's Vision Of The Future, Computing Is Immersive
item.description: May 20, 2017 - Point your camera at a flower and your phone identifies it. Walk into a store and your phone leads you to the item you're looking for. It's part of a future world blurring the virtual and the real.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - Point your camera at a flower and your phone identifies it. Walk into a store and your phone leads you to the item you're looking for. It's part of a future world blurring the virtual and the real. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/20/529146185/in-googles-vision-of-the-future-computing-is-immersive

item.title: Scientists One Step Closer To 3-D-Printed Ovaries To Treat Infertility
item.description: May 20, 2017 - Researchers printed gelatin scaffolds into which they placed ovarian tissue, and then implanted the new organs in mice. Three out of seven female mice produced healthy offspring using the technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - Researchers printed gelatin scaffolds into which they placed ovarian tissue, and then implanted the new organs in mice. Three out of seven female mice produced healthy offspring using the technology. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/20/528646323/scientists-one-step-closer-to-3-d-printed-ovaries-to-treat-infertility

item.title: Google Is Investing In 'Immersive Technology'
item.description: May 19, 2017 - Google is making a push into virtual reality with a headset that doesn't require a user to connect to a phone or computer. Amidst massive hype, virtual reality has been slow to take off.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - Google is making a push into virtual reality with a headset that doesn't require a user to connect to a phone or computer. Amidst massive hype, virtual reality has been slow to take off. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/19/529081034/google-is-investing-in-immersive-technology

item.title: FCC Votes To Begin Rollback Of Net Neutrality Regulations
item.description: May 18, 2017 - The vote begins a months-long process to collect — once again — public comment on how the government should regulate Internet service providers. The FCC is repealing Obama-era rules.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - The vote begins a months-long process to collect — once again — public comment on how the government should regulate Internet service providers. The FCC is repealing Obama-era rules. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/18/528941897/fcc-votes-to-begin-rollback-of-net-neutrality-regulations

item.title: Is 'Internet Addiction' Real?
item.description: May 18, 2017 - What started out as web surfing by a healthy teen descended into online obsession and isolation. Was it depression, internet addiction or both? Whatever you call it, rehab is now part of the answer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - What started out as web surfing by a healthy teen descended into online obsession and isolation. Was it depression, internet addiction or both? Whatever you call it, rehab is now part of the answer. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/18/527799301/is-internet-addiction-real

item.title: Morning News Brief: Robert Mueller As Special Counsel, New Google Products
item.description: May 18, 2017 - Former FBI Director Robert Mueller has been appointed as a special counsel to investigate Russian influence in the election. And Google has unveiled its latest product ideas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - Former FBI Director Robert Mueller has been appointed as a special counsel to investigate Russian influence in the election. And Google has unveiled its latest product ideas. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/18/528899972/morning-news-brief-robert-mueller-as-special-counsel-new-google-products

item.title: Total Failure: When The Space Shuttle Didn't Come Home
item.description: May 17, 2017 - In Part 1 of the series Total Failure, a former NASA official recalls the disastrous mission of the space shuttle Columbia in 2003 and how the accident changed his life forever.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - In Part 1 of the series Total Failure, a former NASA official recalls the disastrous mission of the space shuttle Columbia in 2003 and how the accident changed his life forever. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/17/527052122/total-failure-when-the-space-shuttle-didnt-come-home

item.title: Long Before 'WannaCry' Ransomware, Decades Of Cyber 'Wake-Up Calls'
item.description: May 16, 2017 - "The [WannaCry] attack is a wake-up call for all of us," Microsoft's president wrote about last week's incident. How many times have we heard cyberattacks described this way? Let's look back.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - "The [WannaCry] attack is a wake-up call for all of us," Microsoft's president wrote about last week's incident. How many times have we heard cyberattacks described this way? Let's look back. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/16/528447819/long-before-wannacry-ransomware-decades-of-cyber-wake-up-calls

item.title: WannaCry, Gonna Cry: Cybersecurity In The Face Of Ransomware
item.description:
May 16, 2017 - We live on a hackable planet. How do we stay safe?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-16/wannacry-gonnacry-cybersecurity-in-the-face-of-ransomware
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: North Korea May Be Linked To WannaCry Ransomware, Researchers Say
item.description: May 16, 2017 - Google security researcher Neel Mehta pointed out similarities between WannaCry and malware used by Lazarus, the group that has been blamed for the Sony Pictures hack of 2014.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - Google security researcher Neel Mehta pointed out similarities between WannaCry and malware used by Lazarus, the group that has been blamed for the Sony Pictures hack of 2014. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/16/528587064/north-korea-may-be-linked-to-wannacry-ransomware-researchers-say

item.title: From Kill Switch To Bitcoin, 'WannaCry' Showing Signs Of Amateur Flaws
item.description: May 16, 2017 - There's very little law enforcement can do to catch purveyors of ransomware — unless they slip up. The criminals behind the WannaCry attack may have done just that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - There's very little law enforcement can do to catch purveyors of ransomware — unless they slip up. The criminals behind the WannaCry attack may have done just that. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/16/528570788/from-kill-switch-to-bitcoin-wannacry-showing-signs-of-amateur-flaws

item.title: Cyberattack Culprits Demand Ransom Be Paid In Bitcoins
item.description: May 16, 2017 - Hackers have been targeting users and demanding bitcoins as ransom. Since not all their victims have used bitcoin before, they've been sending their victims bitcoin tutorials.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - Hackers have been targeting users and demanding bitcoins as ransom. Since not all their victims have used bitcoin before, they've been sending their victims bitcoin tutorials. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/16/528570753/cyberattack-culprits-demand-ransom-be-paid-in-bitcoins
